  1. from django.contrib.messages import constants
  2. from django.contrib.messages.storage import default_storage
  4. __all__ = (
  5. 'add_message', 'get_messages',
  6. 'get_level', 'set_level',
  7. 'debug', 'info', 'success', 'warning', 'error',
  8. )
  11. class MessageFailure(Exception):
  12. pass
  15. def add_message(request, level, message, extra_tags='', fail_silently=False):
  16. """
  17. Attempts to add a message to the request using the 'messages' app.
  18. """
  19. if hasattr(request, '_messages'):
  20. return request._messages.add(level, message, extra_tags)
  21. if not fail_silently:
  22. raise MessageFailure('You cannot add messages without installing '
  23. 'django.contrib.messages.middleware.MessageMiddleware')
  26. def get_messages(request):
  27. """
  28. Returns the message storage on the request if it exists, otherwise returns
  29. an empty list.
  30. """
  31. if hasattr(request, '_messages'):
  32. return request._messages
  33. else:
  34. return []
  37. def get_level(request):
  38. """
  39. Returns the minimum level of messages to be recorded.
  41. The default level is the ``MESSAGE_LEVEL`` setting. If this is not found,
  42. the ``INFO`` level is used.
  43. """
  44. if hasattr(request, '_messages'):
  45. storage = request._messages
  46. else:
  47. storage = default_storage(request)
  48. return storage.level
  51. def set_level(request, level):
  52. """
  53. Sets the minimum level of messages to be recorded, returning ``True`` if
  54. the level was recorded successfully.
  56. If set to ``None``, the default level will be used (see the ``get_level``
  57. method).
  58. """
  59. if not hasattr(request, '_messages'):
  60. return False
  61. request._messages.level = level
  62. return True
  65. def debug(request, message, extra_tags='', fail_silently=False):
  66. """
  67. Adds a message with the ``DEBUG`` level.
  68. """
  69. add_message(request, constants.DEBUG, message, extra_tags=extra_tags,
  70. fail_silently=fail_silently)
  73. def info(request, message, extra_tags='', fail_silently=False):
  74. """
  75. Adds a message with the ``INFO`` level.
  76. """
  77. add_message(request, constants.INFO, message, extra_tags=extra_tags,
  78. fail_silently=fail_silently)
  81. def success(request, message, extra_tags='', fail_silently=False):
  82. """
  83. Adds a message with the ``SUCCESS`` level.
  84. """
  85. add_message(request, constants.SUCCESS, message, extra_tags=extra_tags,
  86. fail_silently=fail_silently)
  89. def warning(request, message, extra_tags='', fail_silently=False):
  90. """
  91. Adds a message with the ``WARNING`` level.
  92. """
  93. add_message(request, constants.WARNING, message, extra_tags=extra_tags,
  94. fail_silently=fail_silently)
  97. def error(request, message, extra_tags='', fail_silently=False):
  98. """
  99. Adds a message with the ``ERROR`` level.
  100. """
  101. add_message(request, constants.ERROR, message, extra_tags=extra_tags,
  102. fail_silently=fail_silently)
